title.rendered: What You Need To Know About The Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium Before You Go

content.rendered:
The captivating Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium is a popular spot that offers visitors a unique underwater journey through 12 themed zones. Home to over 10,000 aquatic creatures and a number of exhibits, visitors can explore the beautiful biodiversity, learn more about its learning programmes and attend a range of events at its atrium. But what sets the aquarium apart is its immersive approach to educating people of all ages about marine life and its conservation efforts.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by 🐧SEA LIFE Melbourne🦈 (@sealifemelbourneaquarium)

Why is Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium so special?

Sea Life Melbourne offers unique experiences such as the chance to walk through the Oceanarium, a glass tunnel surrounded by sharks and other marine animals, making for a memorable plan for visitors of all ages. Other highlights are the Interactive Wonder Room, where kids can colour in jellyfish, meet the penguins, and more!

What can you do at Sea Life Aquarium in Melbourne?

Sea Life Melbourne aquarium tickets start at $39.60, although there are different types of tickets available. The aquarium also features educational presentations, feeding sessions, and behind-the-scenes tours, providing visitors with the opportunity to learn about marine conservation and the importance of protecting ocean ecosystems.

Additionally, a Candlelight concert at the aquarium is a truly captivating experience. It merges the enchantment of live music with the mesmerizing beauty of a sea of candles and majestic marine life. As the melodies fill the air, guests are immersed in a sensory journey where they can watch graceful sea creatures glide by and vibrant corals sway to the rhythm. Besides exploring the underwater world and enjoying an intimate tribute under the sea, you can also book several spaces at the Melbourne aquarium for private events and romantic dinners.

Candlelight: Best of Magical Movie Soundtracks
January 7, 2025 6:45 PM + more dates
Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium
From A$95.00
Buy tickets

How long does it take to go around SEA LIFE Aquarium?

On average it takes people 1 to 1.5 hours to go around the aquarium. Additionally, students can opt for a two-hour self-guided visit for the price of $22.00.

Are there sharks and penguins at Sea Life Melbourne?

Yes, there are three species of sharks, namely Grey Nurse Sharks, Black Reef Sharks and Whitetip Reef Sharks at the Melbourne Sea Life aquarium. In addition, you can also interact with two penguin species, the fascinating King and Gentoo penguins.

Can you be late to the Sea Life Aquarium?

In case you arrive late, you’ll be let in on the next available time slot. However, be mindful that the last admission is one hour before closing time.

Located on the banks of the Yarra River beside the Flinders Street Viaduct, visitors can explore interactive exhibits featuring sharks, stingrays, tropical fish and other aquatic creatures. Luckily, getting there is pretty untroublesome. Flinders Street or Southern Cross train stations are only a 10-minute walk away but you can also jump on the tram in the Free Tram Zone to get there. And if you choose to drive instead, there is a public car parking facility on 522 Flinders Lane.

If you’re an avid fan of biology and the underwater world, a visit to the Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium is an absolute must. Additionally, Melbourne’s nr. 1 attraction is currently hosting enchanting Candlelight tributes. It is one of the beautiful venues in the city selected by the Candlelight concert series for its row of performances by candlelight.

Read more: Discover the historic Collingwood Town Hall right here.

@graph.description: Secret Melbourne tracks down the best things to do in the city, from quirky restaurants and hidden bars to the best exhibitions, shows and nightlife in Melbourne.
